content:
Basic

Introduction to the animal, compare it to similar animals. Unicorns are fictional animals that looks a lot like horses.

Physical

Shape, colour, size etc. Unicorns have horns.

Habitat

Geographic distribution, preferred home environment: Lions are wild animals(lives in forest) and mostly found in Africa.

Function

How many limbs, winged, can fly. How they communicate with their environment ie. senses like sight and sound, camouflage, mimicry. Dragons have four limbs, wings that allows them to fly. They can also shoot fire with their mouth

Basic Need

For example oxygen, water, food and sleep

Nutrition

Canivorous, prefers to eat rat

Growth

Rate of growh, maturity, developemental milestone

Excretion

Types and frequency e.g. Faeces, sweat, carbon dioxide, urine, molting, shed fur

Reproduction

Genders, types of mating, offsprings, internal or external fertilisation(e.g. lay eggs), infant care like lactation

Culture

How the creature are viewed in the society, dispicted in literature, films or even flags e.g. lions are asssociated with being majestic or royal

Life cycle

Average life span, weakness and strengths, and predators

Additional information
